title: The Treasury Department is considering a Trump $1 coin. Is that legal?
shortDescription: The Treasury Department announced the proposed $1 coins bearing Trump’s image as part of a campaign to commemorate America’s 250th birthday.

title: Government shutdown will continue as Senate votes fail
shortDescription: The government remains closed for the weekend. Two Democrats and an independent voted to end the shutdown, but the 54-44 vote left Republicans short.

title: Hamas agrees to part of Trump’s Gaza plan
shortDescription: Hamas said it will release Israeli hostages under President Donald Trump’s Gaza plan but refuses to disarm before Israel ends occupation.

title: Supreme Court lets Trump strip deportation protections for Venezuelan migrants
shortDescription: The Trump administration wants to end a program that allows some Venezuelans to live and work temporarily in the United States.

title: Trump tells Israel to stop bombing Gaza so hostages can be released
shortDescription: Hamas agreed to release all Israeli hostages under the terms of Trump's plan and signaled readiness to enter negotiations to end the war in Gaza.

title: Trump and Epstein statue returns to DC
shortDescription: A statue of President Donald Trump holding hands with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein returned to National Mall a week after it was removed by NPS.

title: Trump gives Hamas ultimatum on peace plan
shortDescription: President Donald Trump announced that he is giving Hamas a deadline of 6 p.m. on Oct. 5 to respond to his proposal to end the Israel-Hamas war before they are "hunted down, and killed."

title: Trump says Hamas must accept Gaza deal soon or face 'hell'
shortDescription: Trump gave Hamas a new deadline to accept his proposal to end the war in Gaza, and threatened a new level of violent reprisal if they refuse.

title: Trump administration freezes Chicago funding amid shutdown
shortDescription: The administration continues to target federal money for blue cities and states amid the government shutdown. Meanwhile, red Florida gets millions.

title: Government shutdown will crash into weekend as Senate votes fail
shortDescription: Two Democrats and an independent voted for a GOP measure to end the shutdown, but the 54-44 vote left Republicans short of the 60 votes needed.

title: Did Trump say a shutdown falls on the president? Yes, before he ran
shortDescription: President Donald Trump previously said a shutdown is the responsibility of the president when Barack Obama was in the White House in 2011 and 2013.

title: The Trump administration wants control of agencies like the FCC
shortDescription: The Trump administration has been seeking greater power over independent agencies. But if the president controls the FCC, will speech be free?

title: Trump urges colleges to sign policy compact to boost access to funds
shortDescription: The Trump administration has asked nine universities to sign a compact committing their schools to adopt Trump's higher education agenda.

title: Trump tariffs hurting soybean farmers
shortDescription: President Trump has acknowledged tariffs are hurting soybean farmers, the country's largest agricultural export.

title: Education Department emails blame Democrats for shutdown
shortDescription: Outgoing messages from furloughed agency staffers say the government shutdown is Democrats' fault.
